Work¶

Each user can have a lot of works. The base class for this is udata.models.Work. The name of employer (inst attribute) is language independent (alos begin_year and end_year). The position and comments can be translated (function and comments attribute).

Descrition of the class and inner methods¶

class udata.models.Work(*args, **kwargs)¶

Work experience

Todo

need to make function param to be a ForeignKey and make a new model with a list of all localized variants of positions

inst = None¶

The name of employer (like Leg&Co SRL or Microsoft)

translations¶
Parameters:
  • function (str) – the localized name of position
  • comments (str) – the localized comments about this position
begin_year = None¶

Year when the user start to work on this position

end_year = None¶

Year when he ends to work on this position

human¶

The linked udata.models.Human

edit(inst, function, comments, begin_year, end_year)¶

Method for edit the Work instance with given language

Parameters:
  • inst (str or unicode) – The name of employer
  • function (str or unicode) – localized name of position
  • comments (str or unicode) – localized comments about this work
  • begin_year (int) – year when the user start to work in this position
  • end_year (int) – year when he ends to work in this position
Returns:

True if all works fine
Return type:

boolean

Additional functions¶

At the same time we have some additional functions for hepling us in our work.

udata.views.create_work(human, inst, position, begin_year, end_year, comments)¶

Create a new udata.models.Work

Parameters:
  • human (udata.models.Human) – a linked human instance
  • inst (str) – institution name
  • position (str) – position name
  • begin_year (int) – the begin work year
  • end_year (int) – the end work year
  • comments (str) – comments about this work
Returns:

a resulted instance
Return type:

udata.models.Work
